name: InterContinental Hotel Warsaw

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: City trip from 6 till 8 August 2006. Here are our comments:
reviews.title: Great hotel, perfect location!

reviews.text: > Location: perfectly situated, in front of the Palace of Culture and Science (better know as PEKIN). There are a lot of busses available and the main train station is 200 m away with other busses as well. Shopping is also easy, you have to walk 500 m to reach a commercial area.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel & Brilliant City

reviews.text: > Service: friendly welcome… but it went not so good after. The first morning, we noticed that there were towels for 1 person (we made it clear when we reserved that we needed a double room…), no wardrobes and no slippers. I called the reception immediately and asked for a second set of towels. After 15 minutes, nobody showed. I called the reception again. They promised to send someone. We waited a few minutes, in vain. I decided to go tell the receptionist what I was thinking about that kind of service. On my way to the lift, I met the ‘Public Relations Coordinator’ of the hotel. She asked me if everything was ok and I informed her about my anger. We arrived at the reception and she explains in Polish that I was not too happy the way it went. A few minutes later, we eventually received our second set of towels.
reviews.title: Great hotel in Warsaw

reviews.text: > Room: breath-taking view on Warsaw from the 30th floor! The room was nicely furbished and a big fruits basket welcomes us. Flawless (except for the towels as said earlier).
reviews.title: Absoloutely Brilliant!

likes.disliked: — the lift made my ears pop!

reviews.text: The Intercontinental Hotel in Warsaw was a wonderful respite for my trip. I had a room on the 33rd floor with a view of the Palace of Culture and the city of Warsaw. The room was large and the bathroom had a separate shower from the tub. There were also slippers and a bathroom. I paid under $150 for one night. It was a great place to relax after two weeks of travelling.
reviews.title: Nice Retreat in Warsaw

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One year on, we returned to Warsaw and to the Intercontinental. We arrived early (0930) but were able to go straight to our room. We were in a corner room with good views. The two rooms next to us were being redecorated but we didn't hear any noise. Plenty of room, good bathroom (excellent walk-in shower) and nice toiletries.
reviews.title: Another great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed our breakfasts (you certainly don't need lunch after them!) - good selection of bread, pastries, cheeses, cold meats, fruits, hot food including freshly cooked omelettes etc. The room was very busy on Saturday morning but they opened up the restaurant next door too.
reviews.title: Great hotel

likes.disliked: — nothing much to dislike apart from city of Warsaw is nothing excitng

reviews.text: The wellness area is fabulous. The gym area's the biggest I've seen in a hotel and they also do classes. The pool has an excellent view and there's also a sauna and separate steam room. We got up there early and it was pretty much deserted.
reviews.title: Top Drawer in Warsaw

likes.liked: — Both the room and the amenities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got a good deal through a consolidator website which offers "secret hotel" deals. They can't mention the hotel name, but it's easy to work out if you've been before or are prepared to do a couple of minutes research (eg this was described as a 5 star hotel with a 43rd floor wellness centre....)
reviews.title: Disappointment

reviews.text: Really good hotel with large luxurious rooms. Buffet restaurant is rich although not great. Location is also convenient for the old town. Internet access is fast and reliable.
reviews.title: Very good hotel

reviews.text: I stayed 1 night (and one in the Le Regina, to compare the 2 for myself, I liked the Regina more, see my review).
reviews.title: Great business hotel

likes.liked: — Close to shops and concert hall, very modern and impressive building
likes.disliked: — For a romantic stay I would not choose it, for the rest it's quite OK

reviews.text: The Intercontinental is well situated in the business area but that's not the nicest part of town. But it is close to the shops and the Filharmonia (12 minute walk) where I went to a concert. It's next to a new to be built complex by Daniel Libeskind, Zlota 44, which is going to be the most luxurious apartment complex of Warsaw ,and next to a huge shopping centre with Multiplex Cinema.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel

reviews.text: On arrival I was asked if I need 1 or 2 keycards .They are needed for the elevator. Each guest needs to put his own card in as the elevator will not stop at your floor without your card, so that's very safe.
reviews.title: Quality hotel

reviews.text: My room 2309 (with view of Palace of Culture) was big and modern, with automatic minibar (will charge every item lifted up, so don't make a mistake). A can of soda is 13 Zloties for example. Nice bathroom with good toiletries.
reviews.title: Convenient location & great room

reviews.text: The Intercontinental Warsaw is conveniently located one block from the Warsaw Central railway station. If you're planning to catch a train, this is a great place to stay the night before.
reviews.title: Gorgeous Hotel!

likes.liked: — Location! The Best Place to Stay if You're Catching a Train, and in the Center of it All!
likes.disliked: — Sticker Shock at Breakfast... a bit expensive.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had booked an excellent weekend rate on the hotel's website, but it did not include what turned out to be a very good but pricey breakfast.
reviews.title: Great place
inter continental hotel
reviews.text: The hotel lives up to all the standards you'd expect of an Intercontinental, and I was extremely happy with my 29th floor room. I had one issue, and they took care of it within 5 minutes. If possible, you may want to ask for a room facing the beautiful Palace of Science & Culture. That's the most prominent feature in the area, and it appears that all rooms have a nice view of the city below. I enjoyed a few drinks and conversation at the first floor bar, as well. Friendly staff.
Overall, the Intercontinental Warsaw is a great place to stay; and (at least on the weekend) it's a great value, too.
reviews.title: High value luxury hotel

reviews.text: I just stayed here for a weekend and loved it. There were one or two things that let it down but firstly the good points:
reviews.title: Beautiful rooms, amazing building

likes.disliked: — I could only stay one night

reviews.text: Lovely Hotel, great staff. Food excellent. Very cheap and spacious rooms. However, it was hot. Warsaw was humid and high 30s. I have stayed in many other big chain hotels and found the air con in this one to be poor.
reviews.title: Great Hotel - albeit climate control poor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Needs to be colder.
reviews.title: A Very Special Hotel

likes.disliked: — room service meals served on trays

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We both spend a significant part of our lives every year staying in
reviews.title: Great choice in Central Warsaw
No room at the 4* hotel despite pre-paying
reviews.text: hotels both in the United Kingdom and abroad. The majority of these make no impression whatsoever while a small number fail to meet expectations and only a small minority leave a favourable impression.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our recent nine night stay at the Warsaw Intercontinental was however
reviews.title: Long weekend in Warsaw

likes.disliked: — Reception staff could learn to SMILE!/ Air conditioning was weak

reviews.text: Intercontinental is one great place to stay when you want to feel a little special.
reviews.title: Simply the best!

likes.liked: — Attentive staff, comfortable rooms, great views, delicious food
likes.disliked: — so hard to leave that hotel:)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed 2 nights from Friday 22 August 2008 and just loved it.
reviews.title: Pros and Cons

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: View from my room (28th floor) was amazing. The room was comfortable, clean and well appointed with a huge bed that you just don't want to get out of. Very nice tea/coffee making facilities and well-stocked mini-bar.
reviews.title: superb hotel as you'd expect
5 Star Opulance
reviews.text: Bathroom was particularly nice and huge with separate shower and tub. Great toiletries.
Breakfast was amazing - extensive selection of international food and very fresh and tasty.
reviews.title: Big disappointment

reviews.text: This is probably one of the better options in Warsaw if you want an "international" hotel, but we were certainly not overwhelmed by our stay.
reviews.title: It's a safe bet but not great!

reviews.text: Plus points: Suite was quite spacious, well furnished and clean. Bathroom had separate tub and shower, but you couldn't describe the bathroom, fittings or towels as luxurious - I would say, serviceable.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay at Intercontinental Warsaw!

reviews.text: The pool is pleasant though small, but I wouldn't rave about it the way some reviewers have.
reviews.title: terrible hotel

likes.disliked: — the unfriendly staff and slow service

reviews.text: For a 5 star city hotel, it is very cheap.
reviews.title: This hotel is fantastic

reviews.text: Minus points - inconsistent service. The staff on the Executive Floor were rather unfriendly, in fact . One evening I went to the Exec Lounge to get a glass of Bailey's. All drinks were locked away (I think it was 10 past 9 in the evening). The waitress reluctantly unlocked the bar to let me have a drink! Most strange and I felt rather uncomfortable.
reviews.title: Very good hotel

reviews.text: I just returned from a fantastic stay at the Intercontinental in Warsaw and for my first stay in Poland, it was an excellent choice.
reviews.title: Best 5 star city centre hotel in Warsaw, with the best hotel leisure club!

likes.liked: — Good food, great city centre location and excellent leisure facilities
likes.disliked: — I had key-card problems to access any floors the lift, which was annoying, but the problem got resolved

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked an executive room on the 41st floor directly through Intercontinental website and as a Priority Club member, it was a very good deal. I had two friends who stayed on the 25th floor and they wished they had paid a bit more for an executive room, as access via a unique key card allowed entrance to the Intercontinental Club Lounge, where breakfast and dinner is complimentary. Delicious desserts, fresh fruit and drinks were available throughout the whole day, until 6pm-8pm when dinner was served. Internet access was also free of charge and there is a mini library and plenty of space for meetings and just to relax and meet with friends or for work. Rooms are very similar as on the regular floors, but executive rooms have nicer toiletries and more desk space. I did speak to a British businessman who visits Warsaw on business on a regular basis and even he agreed that the hotel was good value for the high standard and it is very popular with Polish high-flyers and international business guests as well as tourists wanting luxury accomodation and easy walking distance to the city attractions.
reviews.title: Can't take my mind of it !

reviews.text: The hotel is right in the centre of Warsaw, ideally located for the central station, tram stops are just across the street outside the hotel entrance and buses to and from the airport are frequent and very cheap. No need to waste money on taxis! The staff were friendly and very helpful. Not only is this Intercontinental one of the newest hotels in Warsaw, it also boasts the highest health and fitness club (on the 43rd floor at the top of the hotel! )and facilities are better than most of the other hotels. I spoke to a Polish girl who was a member of the club and she said it was the best and the views of the city from the hotel swimming pool area and jacuzzi are spectacular. There is also a sauna and stream room and separate beauty salon which offers very good treatments for affordable prices. The gym was also quite big for a hotel gym and the equpment was really good.
reviews.title: great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay somewhere nice in Warsaw and if I need to return to Poland, I would want stay here again.
reviews.title: Lush

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stay at the Intercontinental Warsaw in late July, we had booked a standard room from hotelsclick.com for a great price. At the time of the check-In, and for our surprise, we were sent to the 40th floor, one of the Club Intercontinental floors. The room was spacious and elegant, with a notorious attention to all details. The bathroom had both bath and rain shower and it feels very luxurious. But the best feature of our room has to be the view, from a 40th floor window we can see almost the entire city and the huge palace of culture, it’s a delight at night! The end of our afternoons was spent in the pool on the 43th floor, there’s also a Jacuzzi, a Steam Bath, a Sauna and a Gym. The breakfast, with a harp as a background, is very good, with large varieties of things. The location of the hotel is perfect, right next to the main rail station and a shopping center, and you can take a bus or just walk to any place. Our stay here was so good, we are thinking of coming back just for the hotel!
reviews.title: Excellent, Excellent, Excellent!!!

description: The five-star InterContinental Warsaw is an impressive addition to the ever-expanding skyline. Located in the financial district opposite the Palace of Culture and Science, the hotel is a short distance from the main railway station, charming Old Town and the Warsaw Philharmonic. Well worth a visit are the Frederic Chopin Museum and Åazienki Park.
